Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Reverend Herbert Daughtry, House of Lord Church, 415 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER BARRON.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Herbert Daughtry, House of Lord Church, 415 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, New York.

Council Member Barron moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 8, 2002 be adopted and printed by Council Member Reyna.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Felder moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 8, 2002 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages and Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Bruce C. Vladeck, Ph.D. to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the Board of Health, pursuant to Section 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County, and Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Brewer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20010602 ZSM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Parking garage CD#6, Manhattan (010602ZSM)

Items.Title: Communications from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Report of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Aging

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Senate bill 1165-A, and its companion, Assembly bill 3972-A, which would amend the executive law in relation to limiting the cost-sharing responsibilities of eligible participants in the elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage program.
Items.MatterName: Elderly Pharmaceutical Insurance Coverage Program (S.1165-A)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at 549-555 St. Johns Place (Block 1175, Lot 1), Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 422 of the Real Property Tax Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 203).
Items.MatterName: LU 203 - Supportive Housing Program For The Elderly, Saint Teresa of Avila, 549-555 St. Johns Place, Block: 1175 Lot: 1, Brooklyn.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Fire and Criminal

Resolution urging the Governor and the State Legislature to place a moratorium on all executions in New York until the application of capital punishment in New York is investigated and issues of fairness, justice, equality, due process and cost are addressed; and calling upon the United States Congress to pass S.233/H.R.1038, the "National Death Penalty Moratorium Act of 2001," and H.R. 321, the "Accuracy in Judicial Administration Act of 2001."
Items.MatterName: Death Penalty (HR 321, HR 1038)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health

Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing on the New York City Department of Public Health's rat abatement efforts in and around the World Trade Center site.
Items.MatterName: Hearing, DOH rat abatement efforts in and around the WTC site.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Higher Education

Resolution admonishing the Board of Regents of the University of the State of New York (the "Board of Regents") for "breaking tradition" by failing to elect to the position of Chancellor the incumbent Vice Chancellor, as has been the tradition of the Board of Regents, and requesting that the Board of Regents explain to the New York State Legislature, all statewide educational organizations, and to all New Yorkers why they neglected to follow this tradition and to seize the opportunity presented to them to elevate to the position of Chancellor, incumbent Vice Chancellor Sanford, a visionary and committed educational leader who has worked tirelessly on behalf of all the children of the State of New York to provide them with a quality education through the state's public school system.
Items.MatterName: Admonishing the Board of Regents, University of the State of New York  for "breaking tradition" regarding Vice Chancellor Sanford.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of JOEL ARTHUR MIELE, SR. as a member of the New York City Board of Standards and Appeals.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on June 5, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 659 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of JOEL ARTHUR MIELE, SR. as a member of the New York City Board of Standards and Appeals to serve for a term expiring on September 1, 2003.

Res. No. 375

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF JOEL ARTHUR MIELE, SR. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY BOARD OF STANDARDS AND APPEALS.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 659 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of JOEL ARTHUR MIELE, SR. as a member of the New York City Board of Standards and Appeals for a term expiring on September 1, 2003.
Items.MatterName: M 177 - Joel A. Miele, Sr., Appointment, Board of Standards &  Appeals

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of RICHARD EADDY as a member of the New York City Planning Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on June 5, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of RICHARD EADDY as a member of the New York City Planning Commission to serve for a term expiring on June 30, 2005.

Res. No. 376

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF RICHARD EADDY AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY PLANNING COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of RICHARD EADDY as a member of the New York City Planning Commission for a term expiring on June 30, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 178 - Richard W. Eaddy, Appointment, City Planning Commission

Items.Title:

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on June 5, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Public Advocate of KAREN ANGELI PHILLIPS as a member of the New York City Planning Commission to serve for a term expiring on June 30, 2005.


Res. No. 377

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE PUBLIC  ADVOCATE OF RICHARD EADDY AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY PLANNING COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Public Advocate of KAREN ANGELI PHILLIPS as a member of the New York City Planning Commission for a term expiring on June 30, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 183 - Karen Phillips, Appointment, City Planning Commission

Items.Title:
Introduction and Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a for-hire vehicle driver manual.
Items.MatterName: For-hire vehicle driver manual.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to adopt Assembly Bill A.7906 and its companion, State Senate Bill S.5215, which would amend the public health law and the social services law, in relation to instituting a requirement for a criminal history report for nursing home, home care services agency and hospice employees.
Items.MatterName: Instituting a requirement for a criminal history report for nursing home care services agency and hospice employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Assembly Bill A.4601, which would amend the public health law and the executive law, in relation to requiring nursing homes and home care agencies to submit fingerprints of current and prospective employees for the purposes of a search of criminal history records of the division of criminal justice services and establishing a registry of home care services personnel.
Items.MatterName: Requiring nursing homes and home care agencies to submit fingerprints of current and prospective employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to issuance of a certificate of fitness for individuals working on supported scaffolds.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of a certificate of fitness for individuals working on supported scaffolds.

The Clerk (Mr. Victor Robles) announced the presence of a quorum.
ROLL CALL
The President Pro Tem (Council Member Rivera) called the meeting to order.
Roll Call

Resolution authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for municipal park projects, local waterfront revitalization projects, and Hudson River Estuary projects within the City of New York and the signing of associated state contracts under the appropriate laws of New York State.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for certain projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Council to approve a five-year extension of partial real property tax exemptions for Gouverneur Gardens Housing Corporation.
Items.MatterName: Approve a five-year extension of partial real property tax exemptions for Gouverneur Gardens Housing Corporation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact Assembly Bill A.844-A, and its companion Senate Bill, S.1212-A, which would amend and expand Section 364-i of the Social Services law to include mentally ill persons who are discharged, without health insurance, from psychiatric inpatient care at a State mental hospital or a prison operated by the State, County or City of New York, so that such persons shall be presumed eligible for Medicaid coverage from the date of discharge, and so that mentally ill prison inmates can more easily and effectively receive all the benefits of an adequate discharge plan, as mandated in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York, immediately upon release.
Items.MatterName: Discharge of mentally ill persons without health insurance.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services

The City of New York, immediately upon release.
